scanner.filtering

Class Hasher

  • java.lang.Object
    • scanner.filtering.Hasher

  • public class Hasher
extends java.lang.Object
    Hasher class uses MessageDigest to hash a given String using SHA-512
    Since:
    2016-10-26
    Author:
    Chris Porch porchc0@students.rowan.edu

      static boolean checkSHA(java.lang.String word, java.lang.String hash)
      Hashes a given word and checks it against the given hash.

      static java.lang.String hashSHA(java.lang.String word)
      Hashes a given String using SHA-512, encodes it as Base64 and returns it.

    • Method Detail

      • hashSHA

        public static java.lang.String hashSHA(java.lang.String word)
        Hashes a given String using SHA-512, encodes it as Base64 and returns it.
        Parameters:
        word - A String.
        Returns:
        A SHA-512 hash

      • hashArrayListSHA

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> hashArrayListSHA(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> list)

      • checkSHA

        public static boolean checkSHA(java.lang.String word,
                               java.lang.String hash)
                        throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Hashes a given word and checks it against the given hash. Note: preferred way to check SHA hashes is to call hashSHA() on the word then call a .equals() against the hash to be checked against
        Parameters:
        word - A String to be tested against the hash.
        hash - A SHA-512 hash of a String
        Returns:
        true if the given word matches the given hash when it is hashed
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
